turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> Hi, Hi there, good morning.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi, good morning.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I'm Doctor Dean <UNSURE>Resor</UNSURE> from <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE> That's the same thing</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK great! So before we start your appointment, could you please confirm your full name and date of birth?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah sure! Um, my name is <UNSURE>Jim Gowers</UNSURE> and I was born in nineteen fifty eight uh on the eighth of August.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's great. Thank you so much for that. Um, you look a lot younger, so, um

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Does that, that would make you roughly about fifty years old, fifty one, fifty one years old. Is that is that correct or?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah around that. Yeah about sixty, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Six, OK, perfect. All right. So, um, nice to see see you this morning. Are you in a private place where you are OK to speak freely?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, I am. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK fantastic! So um, how can I help you today?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah. I was, I was having, um, a bit of chest discomfort. So, I was doing some gardening, um, a couple of hours ago.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And I felt <UNIN/> not exactly a pain but um like a <UNIN/> a pressure on my chest, um, feels like someone sitting on my chest.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and, I've noticed, um, a bit of nausea, not, no vomiting but, um, I'm pretty sweaty, um, short of breath, and it kind of feels like someone's sitting on my chest.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now, do you have those these symptoms right now or have they gone off now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, they're still present.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, you've still got the chest discomfort right now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We're probably gonna have to call an ambulance for you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> OK. So what I'm gonna do, is I'm gonna task my colleague next to me to sort that out. While we do that I'm gonna ask you a few more questions, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm, <UNSURE>sure</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> We're gonna a bit more information to the, <UNSURE>to help</UNSURE> the ambulance team when they, when they arrive, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So just to, just to double check, um, where exactly in the chest is the pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, it's in the, uh, middle of my chest, um, over, uh, yeah, my my pecs, so, um, yeah but not not necessarily to one side, um, and it's quite diffuse pain.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Is, is it spreading anywhere else, like down into your arm, up to the jaw, in your neck, anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah. It's, it's, um, mainly in my left arm, er, it's feeling a little bit, um, er, painful, and, and in my shoulder as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Do you remember what you were doing at the time?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh yes, so it started uh just when I was gardening. So nothing that was too strenuous um I was just kneeling down and

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, wasn't running or anything, it wasn't during any physical exercise.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. And, and how much activity do you do normally? Do you walk a lot or do you run or do you <UNIN/> do anything?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, I don't, I, I generally don't do much activity at all, um, you know.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you had this before?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, this is the first time, actually.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Can <UNIN/> are you aware of any palpitations, like your heart beating faster or more prominently than normal?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah. It's, it's beating a bit faster now. I think that's 'cause I'm a little bit stressed.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, about the situation but I haven't noticed it, um, beating faster than usual, um, and I did today.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, I know you're stressed but, but we've got an ambulance coming on the way, OK? So um, we'll take care of everything, so don't, don't <UNSURE>worry</UNSURE>. Who's in the house with you at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, thank you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, no one's in the house at the moment.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, and is your front door open?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yes, it's open.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK so maybe we'll, we'll speak maybe in the hallway to the front door. Have the front door open so that, in case people need access, they could access you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Alright. Um, so, um, uh, are you a smoker at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, I smoke, um, a fair bit so I smoke about ten cigarettes, uh, a day. Um, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How long have you been smoking for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, for the past fifteen years.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fifteen years, OK. Um, do you have, um, high blood pressure or high cholesterol or diabetes <UNSURE>or anything</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I have high blood, uh, blood pressure, but, um, not diabetes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Have you ever had your cholesterol checked?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. Um, now anyone in your wider <UNIN/> in, in your family, sorry, in your parents, did either of them have any heart problems, or heart attacks, or anything like that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yes, so, my, um, father died of a heart attack, um, and my mother had some heart problems.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, I'm sorry to hear about your father. Can you remember what age roughly he was when he had, he had the heart attack?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, he was about my age.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right so <UNIN/> just under sixty, around sixty.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, around sixty, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, OK, alright. Um, do you drink much alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, I drink, um, about, per week, probably about seven or eight pints a week.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, is that a, a beer you're talking about, yeah?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh. Yeah, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, I, I can't tell from the video, are you overweight?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yes, I'm overweight, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Alright. Um, uh now um, you, do you normally live alone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. I live alone, uh, at the moment. Yeah, uh, it's just me in the house.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK, and, and, uh, are you working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah yeah, I, I work, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, what do you work as?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I work as a restaurant owner. So I own a sushi shop.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Alright. Um, so, um, the, the symptoms that you've described to me

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, they indicate the possibility of, um, a heart attack.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK? So, I'm not saying you definitely have a heart attack, but we, that, it's our number one priority to exclude that.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, so ambulance team will be with you very shortly.  I'm gonna stay on the line with you until they come.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/> when they come, what they'll do is, they're gonna put some stickers on your chest and do an ECG.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, yeah. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And then decide where to take you after that, OK? <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, <UNSURE>no</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And um, what, what, uh, can I just double check? Do you have, um, any allergies to any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, actually, I have, um, an allergy to aspirin.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, and no other allergies.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure. Uh, what's the nature of that allergy to aspirin? Do you, does it, does it cause you heartburn? Or is it like <UNIN/> an allergic reaction?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Um</UNSURE>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, uh, it's an allergic reaction, so I swell up, um, a bit, but, um, nothing life threatening.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've, I, sometimes even have it and it's, it's a, it's a mild reaction to it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. It's very important that you communicate that to the hospital.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, the detail you just told me, because, um, we, we may need to consider aspirin despite <UNSURE>allergy</UNSURE>, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, alright, um, now in terms of, um, what happens from here

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That <UNIN/> team will assess you and then they may take you into one hospital or another based on how bad <UNIN/>, what the ECG looks like and what kind of treatment you might need, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, what I'm going to do is, we'll stay on the line for the time being, OK, until they come,  and then, um, once they come, then I'll hand over to them and I'll explain what's going on, alright?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK, OK, sure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> we'll end the conversation after the <UNSURE>purposes</UNSURE>. Is that OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, that's, OK. OK, thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> thanks! Bye!

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Thank you. Bye.
